qas.question: How many state grammar schools are in Lancashire?
How many state schools are in Lancashire?
How many independant schools are in Lancashire?
Who has the largest school population?
Who has the smallest school population?
How many sixth form colleges are there in Lancashire?
How many schools are there in total in the Clitheroe area?
What's the size of the South Ribble school population?
In what year was the Church of England established?
How many Catholic faith schools are there in Lancashire?

context: Lancashire has a mostly comprehensive system with <a0_0><b9_0>four<b9_0/><a0_0/> state grammar schools. Not including sixth form colleges, there are <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0>77<b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/> state schools (not including Burnley's new schools) and <a2_0><b5_0>24<b5_0/><a2_0/> independent schools. The Clitheroe area has secondary modern schools. Sixth form provision is limited at most schools in most districts, with only Fylde and Lancaster districts having mostly sixth forms at schools. The rest depend on FE colleges and sixth form colleges, where they exist. <a3_0>South Ribble<a3_0/> has the largest school population and <a4_0>Fylde<a4_0/> the smallest (only three schools). Burnley's schools have had a new broom and have essentially been knocked down and started again in <b8_0>2006<b8_0/>. There are many Church of England and Catholic faith schools in Lancashire.
